org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington

div1.p: In the District Court of Washington Terrtorry of the 3rd Judicial District holding terms at Seattle
In the matter of the application of C. W. Hutchinson for relief in Habeas Corpus Writ} Petition
To the Hon R. S. Greene Judge of the above court:
C. H. Hutchinson petitioner herein makes complaint to your Honor and says:

That he is restrained of his liberty by one Lewis VanW H Harris Doren a constable of the Seatle Tacoma Precinct in King County to T: and is so restrained by him the said constable HarrisVan Dorenat and in the city of Seattle & confined in the personal custody of said constable

II That the pretended cause or pretenses of such illegal restraints is a charge or pretended complaint against your petitioner
charging or purporting to dis charge this petitioner with the charge of fraudulently and feloniously embezzing & converting to his own use a certain sum of money to wit $240 in money from one W H Harris, said complaint having been made by one W H Harris; the custody of this petitioner is by virtue of a pretended warrant, purporting to issue from one Alex Campbell who purports to be a Justice of the Peace said pretended warrant being in the hands of the said Lewis Van Doren W H Harris constable as aforesaid, said Warrant purporting to be from Pierce County in this Territory

III That the said restraint is illegal, that the said illegality of such restraint consists in the unlawful detention of your petitioner by & through what a certain piece of paper purporting to be a warrant, which paper is of no consequences, is null
void & to no effect, that the further illegallity of such saw detention is that theres no offense known to the laws of Washington Territory named in such pretended warrant.

Therefore petitioner prays that your Honor issue to him a writ of Habeas Corpus directed to the said Lewis Van DorenW H Harris commanding him to be and appear before your honor at same time certain fixed and definite immediately or as soon as your honor will see fit and to then and have the body of your petitioner that your Honor may then & there enquire of and determine why your Petitioner is so illegally restrained of his liberty
And Your Petitioner Will ever pray etc.
C. W. Hutchinson by his attorneys at Law Rasin & Gilman and Jas H. Lewis
Territory of Washington County of King} SS
C.W.Hutchinson being duly sworn on oath says that he is the petitioner named in the foregoing petition and has read the said petition and knows its contents & believes the same true
C. W. Hutchinson
Sworn to & subscribed before me this 12th day of November at 1885
L. C. Gilman Notary Public
FILE NOV 18, 1885
In the District Court, Third Judicial District, holding Terms at Seattle
In re application at plaintiff VS. C. W. Hutchinson and for Habeas Corpus Defendant
Petition of Hutchinson
FILED NOV 12 1885 James Seavey, Clerk By James P. Ludlow Deputy Clerk.
Burke & Rasin. and Gilman and James Attorneys for Hamilton Lewis Attorneys for Petitioner
